website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight and reasonably priced. Worth considering for small to midsize yards, and for anyone who prefers a lighter  gas-powered trimmer.
pros: One of the more affordable options by the brand
Gas powered, yet lightweight with a curved shaft for easy handling for most users
cons: Shaft is a bit short, which could be awkward for very tall users
Not suited for tough trimming tasks

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worst piece of garbage I have ever owned!! It never ran right, and now less than a year old I can not even get it to start so I can try to adjust the carb! I even bought their fuel to make sure the oil ratio was perfect! Good luck getting someone from the company to help you! You can only email or message them and maybe they will get back to you in a few days if you're lucky! Do yourself a favor and pass on this one!! I have folded it in half so it fits into the garbage pail better. That's where it belongs!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Buy a Stihl
customer_reviews.text: I bought this assuming that the Husqvarna name still stood for quality. It doesn't. This piece of junk barely started out of the box, ran for less than 10 minutes, and refuses to start again. I wont be buying any of your products again. My Stihl fs-91 has ran for 3 years without a single problem and it gets used almost daily.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Bray

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, well built product from Husqvarna.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding weed eater I love this thing. But I’ve been sold on husqvarna for a long time, I’ve had their lawn mowers and chainsaws, they have quality products. This thing will butcher tall grass and weeds you wouldn’t think it could. I was very impressed with it’s power so they have a very happy customer.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: We had one before and used it about five years until we couldn't replacement parts for the starter. Bought a Stihl and used it for five years until dog knocked parts all over. Bought this second one based on first one. We have a good sized farm and it does the job for us. We use .105 line on it sold here at Amazon (red).
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Marie Randall

customer_reviews.title: No complaints here
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Light weight, starts easy, cuts great. No compliants here
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna trimmer
customer_reviews.text: On page 11 of the operator’s manual under “To start a cold engine” it states “Note: Do not pull the throttle trigger while you start the engine”. My unit will not start unless I pull the throttle trigger. I do not know if my unit is one of, but I would hope that Husqvarna addresses this situation. All of the above being stated, this unit, so far, is far superior to the Ryobi it replaces. Relatively light weight. Once I studied the cartoon closely, I decided that I like the way the trimmer line is loaded to the unit. One needs to be sure that the cartoon explaining the loading feature is clearly understood.
customer_reviews.author: InksterCharlie

customer_reviews.title: Happy Happy Happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Having always "borrowed" strimmers in the past I decided to splash out and buy my own. I read about the different options before buying and this Husqvarna 129C did have excellent comments made about it. The set up was straight forward and first time using it, it performed really well. My spouse said compared to all the others he used previously this was fantastic. I have a lot of horrible weeds in my garden area, more than grassy areas, and it tackled them with ease. Yesterday was a good test and like I said, I am happy happy happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Gomez

customer_reviews.title: If it gets warm, it’s hard to start
customer_reviews.text: Ok the good. 1) lightweight 2) powerful 3) good head for string The bad 1) almost impossible to start 2) restarting it after it’s warm takes forever 3) tricky trigger, pull it too fast the seeder dies I don’t recommend. It’s powerful but it’s hard to start.
customer_reviews.author: Helder F. Jacinto

customer_reviews.title: Warranty on weed trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased last summer of 2018 for the name. Worked well up until a week ago. Used it on my lawn one day but did not finish because of rain. Two days later went out to finish weeding and it would not start. It always started with 2to 3 pulls. Motor sounds and feels tight when trying to start. Is there a warranty on this ??
customer_reviews.author: Mike Marino

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Husband had to have this! He loves it. I ended up buying extra line due to another review I read saying it came with a small amount. He still is using the line that came with it and has used this once a week for the entire cutting season so far.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal smet

customer_reviews.title: Its a great machine!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my husband and he is very pleased with the unit. It starts easily and is light weight enough for him to do a large area before he has to take a break! He says he is very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: sheila

customer_reviews.title: I’m not sure
customer_reviews.text: It has a small fuel tank and the string head is not replaceable
customer_reviews.author: Bill Rayburn

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Hard to start. Directions say to prime 10 times, pull with chock on 3 times then close choke and continue pull starting. Once started let warm up for 60 seconds. Very painful process and the 60 second warm up is more like 90-120. Weak motor for trimming. And one of the most unfriendly line loading spools I've ever used. Dad was right, You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I received this item with out the screws to put it together. I had to call the Manufacturer and had to pay for the missing parts. I will not order from them again
customer_reviews.author: jsilvers

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT...THAT SIMPLE
customer_reviews.text: Real simple....I love this Husqvarna trimmer. Easy to assemble, fast smooth start, runs great with plenty of power, low vibration and to me it’s the quietest trimmer I’ve ever owned. All in all this is my favorite trimmer of all.
customer_reviews.author: Thunderfoot

customer_reviews.title: Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: I will increase this to a 5 star if I can get all of the connecting hardware. Missing the necessary pieces to connect the handle and the string guard??
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the money
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally like gasoline powered weed whackers, but this one is great. It's been very reliable and easy to start every time.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W.

customer_reviews.title: Not ergonmonic and has a very weak engine.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Very weak engine with poor cutting results. My old electric cheap Black and Decker cut better and was easier to use. Doesn't have a gas shut off so it is going to be a bear to start after sitting with a gummed up carb. If they don't take it back I am just going to put it on the curb with a free sign. Junk DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: You will LOVE this trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several different trimmers in my life, used Husqvarna products before; mowers etc.... THIS trimmer by far is the BEST I've ever used. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: marianne cunniff

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable Husqvarna at all
customer_reviews.text: Since bought new 3 months never ran right. Will run for about 10 min. And then won’t restart. Gave it a day to cool down... still won’t start. Previous trimmer was a husqvarna that lasted 12 years without a trouble til earlier this year. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: zoltan dobrossy

customer_reviews.title: Less than stellar quality
customer_reviews.text: 5 uses and the pull string came apart. The knot end in the unit was not properly tied off. Trying to run the pull chord back in this unit was a major pain to say the least. Extremely aggravated customer.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Mckenzie III

customer_reviews.title: “Replace or Repair only”
customer_reviews.text: Power is great. But makes a bad rattling sound. It works fine, but I worry there is something wrong with its internals. Huskvarna is a “replace or repair only” company so don’t feel like you’ll be able to return. Also, if you are wanting to edge with this weed wacker, get something with a straight shaft becuase this one will not work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer was defective out of the box; the carborator was defective; it wouldn't hold. I contacted Husqvarna, followed their steps and they confirmed the item was defective.
customer_reviews.author: robert sforza

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: I had electric trimmer and it just took forever and it was a pain to drag cords around. Bought this trimmer, it came with enough 2stroke for a gallon and it fired up on the first try. Very powerful and seems like it's gonna make my life easier in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy- Shaft bent first use!
customer_reviews.text: The shaft on this mower bent the first time being used - no it was not banged too hard on the ground to feed the line- it was used for about 30 mins around house- tree’s- fence- typical residential use - I was shocked for this to happen - husqvarna is known for its quality products - this one was an absolute dud! Sorry- I will not buy this again- nor will I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: ruth ann schiela

customer_reviews.title: Stubborn Starter, Difficulties Edging
customer_reviews.text: Regardless of how warm the engine is, the primer pumps, choke pulls, and 60s warm up period must be employed for every start. Additionally, every start has been a rough start. Edging sidewalks is also problematic as the engine seems to want to cut out when the machine is turned on end to edge sidewalks. Gas tank is small. Tall grass also gets clogged in the guard regularly. This is a lightweight trimmer for residential use with a good price point, but not for heavy lifting big jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Colby

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna is a very good brand. My husband uses it and he likes it. This is his second one.
customer_reviews.text: Husqvarna is a very good brand. My husband uses it and he likes it. This is his second one.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very durable, great quality, lightweight, easy to use and start.
customer_reviews.author: Bear Sayer

customer_reviews.title: Great handling and lightweight. Weak motor.
customer_reviews.text: Great feeling product. It’s lightweight and the handling is perfect. Only issue is it’s kind of weak. You have to constantly be aware of the throttle or the motor will automatically shut off with too much pressure.
customer_reviews.author: John Burns

customer_reviews.title: Stalled out a lot
customer_reviews.text: Stalled out way too much. My last husqvarna trimmer worked like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, powerful and string is easy to put on
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Zayas

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Like the trimmer. Might change the cutting string to make it trim better.
customer_reviews.author: wwc

customer_reviews.title: Undoubtedly the Best
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable control in speed and line length. Quite possibly the best weed wacker that I've ever had in my hands, and I've had many !
customer_reviews.author: Archie Dean

customer_reviews.title: Low quality product compared to Echo trimmer.
customer_reviews.text: First Husqvarna 129C arrived but would shut off when throttled to trim grass. Returned it and got replacement unit. Replacement unit operates, but compared to the Echo I used previously, it is not of the same quality and does not do as good a job. Hope it lasts a year. I would not get another Husqvarna.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use.
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to thread with line and won't feed well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bertoldie

customer_reviews.title: Works great and the line feed works smoothly
customer_reviews.text: Starts and runs great much quiter than my old 1
customer_reviews.author: Mark Antoinetti

customer_reviews.title: Weedeater
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Great weed eater. Does what it's supposed to do. Awesome price
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Lots of power for a great price!! Always been a fan of Husqvarna, they are known for their great tools and this one didn’t disappoint!!
customer_reviews.author: Myles

customer_reviews.title: For general use only
customer_reviews.text: Great product for general use. Not good for heavy duty use
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S.

customer_reviews.title: Shut off switch doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: We just tired using this and the shutoff does not work. I can’t find how or who to contact about this issue either. I’m assuming because it has gas and oil in it that it can’t be returned though?
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Cardello

customer_reviews.title: No power at all
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that this machine has absolutely no power or push to it at all. I have other Husqvarna equipment and they are great, this one, not so good!
customer_reviews.author: Susan L. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves it not heavy that's what he wanted . lightweight
customer_reviews.author: Becky Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: useless product
customer_reviews.text: husky has lousy customer service, two hours wait time and told that they wont do anything about a defective pull cord
customer_reviews.author: keith brock

customer_reviews.title: Need a trimmer guard
customer_reviews.text: When I unpacked my trimmer, there was no guard sent for it. I can't use it without one. Where could I get one please.. Terri Hamilton
customer_reviews.author: Terri Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this item in May and by July it stopped running. No way to contact the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Angie White

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Nice for a medium sized yard. I would replace the bump head that comes with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: This weed Wacker is the best one iv ever owned. And light enough my 5 year old can use it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris hultquist

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality!
customer_reviews.text: My husband couldn't be happier with this purchase! Great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Some Assembly Required
customer_reviews.text: After you learn to pull on the string and work the choke, you've got it.
customer_reviews.author: Monsoon Mom

product_meta.title: Husqvarna 129C 17" Cutting Path Gas String Trimmer,Orange
product_meta.description: The curved 129C is your go to gas trimmer when you need a powerful & easy to use tool to tackle the grass & weeds in your yd. Our Smart start trimmer technology reduces starter cord resistance by 40% to allow for easy engine starts. The unique x-torque engine reduces fuel consumption & emission levels & the strong, braided trimmer line is ready for work.
feature_bullets: Features a 27. 6cc 2-cycle engine which powers the 17 inch (cutting width) trimmer head
The curved shaft design helps to evenly distribute the weight of the trimmer so you can operate for longer periods with greater comfort
Trimmer engine runs on a mixture of unleaded gas and 2-cycle oil (2. 6 oz. Bottle is included, see bottle for mixing instructions)
Easily release New trimmer line as you work by tapping the trimmer head against the grass to activate the tap 'N Go line release feature
Have no worries when it is time to replace the trimmer line - the T25 trimmer head is designed for simple and easy line reloading
A translucent fuel tank allows you to visually Monitor your fuel level as you work
Conveniently remove unwanted air from the carburetor and Fuel system using the air purge primer bulb
String trimmer is backed by a 2-year limited for residential use

specifications.Domestic Shipping: This item is available for shipping in the U.S. except for California and to select countries outside the U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars252 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
